	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage53"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#RIGL-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Rigel Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Property and equipment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Property and equipment are stated at cost. Depreciation is calculated using the straight
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;line method over the estimated useful lives of the assets, which range from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	seven
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Revenue recognition
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We present revenue from our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	collaboration
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	arrangements under the FASB ASC 808,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Collaboration Arrangements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. The terms of these agreements generally contain multiple elements, or deliverables, which may include (i) granting of license rights to our program, (ii) participation in a joint research committee, (iii) performance of research activities, and (iv) clinical supply and materials. The payments we receive under these arrangements typically include one or more of the following: non-refundable, up-front fees; funding of research and/or development efforts; contingent fees due upon the achievement of specified triggering events; and/or royalties on future product sales. We recognize revenue for the performance of services or the delivery of products when each of the following four criteria is met: (i) persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists; (ii) products are delivered or as services are rendered; (iii) the sales price is fixed or determinable; and (iv) collectability is reasonably assured.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our revenue arrangements with multiple elements are evaluated under FASB ASC 605
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	25,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Multiple Element Arrangements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, and are divided into separate units of accounting if certain criteria are met, including whether the deliverables have stand-alone value, based on the relevant facts and circumstances for each arrangement. The consideration we receive under collaboration arrangements is allocated among the separate units of accounting based on the selling price hierarchy, and the applicable revenue recognition criteria is applied to each of the separate units. We make significant judgments and estimates in the allocation of the consideration among the deliverables under the agreement, as well as the determination of the periods the units will be delivered to our collaborators. If there are deliverables in an arrangement that are not separable from other aspects of the contractual relationship, they are treated as a combined unit of accounting, with the allocated revenue for the combined unit recognized in a manner consistent with the revenue recognition applicable to the final deliverable in the combined unit. Payments received prior to satisfying the relevant revenue recognition criteria are recorded as deferred revenue in the accompanying balance sheets and recognized as revenue when the revenue recognition criteria are met.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We typically receive non-refundable, up-front payments when licensing our intellectual property, which often occurs in conjunction with a research and development agreement. If we believe that the license to our intellectual property has stand-alone value, we generally recognize revenue attributed to the license upon delivery provided that there are no future performance requirements for use of the license. When we believe that the license to our intellectual property does not have stand-alone value, we would recognize revenue attributed to the license ratably from the effective date of the agreement or the delivery of the license up to the estimated completion date of the undelivered performance obligation. Revenues related to the research services with our corporate collaborators are recognized as research services are performed over the related research period. Under these agreements, we are required to perform research activities as specified in the agreement. The payments received are not refundable and are based on a contractual cost per full-time equivalent employee working on the project. Our research and development expenses under the collaborative research agreements approximate the revenue recognized under such agreements over the research period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Revenues associated with substantive, at-risk milestones pursuant to collaborative agreements are recognized upon achievement of the milestones. We consider a milestone to be substantive at the inception of the arrangement if it is commensurate with either our performance to achieve the milestone or the enhancement of the value of the delivered item as a result of a specific outcome resulting from our performance to achieve the milestone, it relates solely to past performance and it is reasonable relative to all of the deliverables and payment terms within the arrangement. Non-refundable contingent future amounts receivable in connection with future events specified in collaboration agreements that are not considered milestones such as payments contingent solely upon the passage of time or the result of our collaborator's performance will be recognized as revenue when the recognition criteria discussed above are met.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	52
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage54"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#RIGL-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Rigel Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Research and development expenses
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Research and development expenses include costs for scientific personnel, supplies, equipment, consultants, research sponsored by us, allocated facility costs, costs related to pre
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;clinical and clinical trials, including raw materials, and stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation expense. All such costs are charged to research and development expense as incurred and at the time raw materials are purchased.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Research and development accruals
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have various contracts with third parties related to our research and development activities. Costs that are incurred for services rendered, but not billed to us, as of the end of the period are estimated and accrued. We make estimates of the amounts incurred in each period based on the information available to us and our knowledge of the nature of the contractual activities generating such costs. Expenses related to other research and development contracts, such as research contracts, toxicology study contracts and manufacturing contracts are estimated to be incurred generally on a straight
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;line basis over the duration of the contracts. Raw materials and study materials purchased for us by third parties are expensed at the time of purchase.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Leases
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We currently lease our research and office space under a noncancelable lease agreement with our landlord through January 2018. In December 2014, we entered into a sublease agreement with an unrelated third party to occupy a portion of our research and office space. In connection with this sublease, we recognized a loss on the sublease of $9.3&nbsp;million during the fourth quarter of 2014. We record rent expense on a straight
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;line basis for our lease, net of sublease income, wherein such arrangements contain scheduled rent increases over the term of the lease and sublease, respectively. For our sublease arrangement which we classified as an operating lease, our loss on the sublease is comprised of the present value of our future payments to our landlord less the present value of our future rent payments expected from our subtenant over the term of the sublease. The present value factor, which also affects the level of accreted interest expense that we will recognize as additional charges over the term of the lease, is based on our estimate of our credit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;risk adjusted borrowing rate at the time the initial sublease liability is calculated. Our estimate of our credit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;risk adjusted borrowing rate was based on our comparison of the rates used by other companies of our size, our financial condition at the time we entered into such sublease agreement, as well as other factors that would affect our credit worthiness.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Contingencies
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are subject to claims related to the patent protection of certain of our technologies, as well as a purported securities class action lawsuit and other litigation. We are required to assess the likelihood of any adverse judgments or outcomes to these matters as well as potential ranges of probable losses. A determination of the amount of reserves required, if any, for these contingencies is made after careful analysis of each individual issue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	axes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We use the asset and liability method to account for income taxes. Deferred tax assets and liabilities are recognized for the future tax consequences attributable to differences between the financial statement carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities and their respective tax bases and operating loss and tax credit carryforwards. Deferred tax assets and liabilities are measured using enacted tax rates expected to apply to taxable income in the years in which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered or settled. The effect on deferred tax assets and liabilities from a change in tax rates is recognized in income in the period the change is enacted. A valuation allowance is established to reduce deferred tax assets to an amount whose realization is more likely than not.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	53
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage55"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#RIGL-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Rigel Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Net loss per share
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Basic net loss per share is computed by dividing net loss by the weighted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;average number of shares of common stock outstanding during the period. Diluted net loss per share is computed by dividing net loss by the weighted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;average number of shares of common stock outstanding during the period and the number of additional shares of common stock that would have been outstanding if potentially dilutive securities had been issued. Potentially dilutive securities include warrant and stock options and shares issuable under our Purchase Plan. The dilutive effect of these potentially dilutive securities is reflected in diluted earnings per share by application of the treasury stock method. Under the treasury stock method, an increase in the fair market value of our common stock can result in a greater dilutive effect from potentially dilutive securities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The following table sets forth the computation of basic and diluted net loss per share (in thousands
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	except per share amounts):
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During the periods presented, we had securities which could potentially dilute basic loss per share, but were excluded from the computation of diluted net loss per share
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for all periods presented
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, as their effect would have been antidilutive.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	These securities consist of the following (in thousands except per share data):

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Recent accounting pronouncements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In August 2014, th
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	e FASB issued ASU No. 2014-15&#x2014;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Disclosure of Uncertainties about an Entity&#x2019;s Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	under ASC Subtopic 205-40,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Presentation of Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2014;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Going Concern
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. ASU No. 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-15 provides guidance about management&#x2019;s responsibility to evaluate whether there is substantial doubt about an entity&#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern and to provide related footnote disclosures. Management&#x2019;s evaluation should be based on relevant conditions and events that are known and reasonably knowable at the date that the financial statements are issued (or at the date that the financial statements are available to be issued when applicable). Substantial doubt about an entity&#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern exists when relevant conditions and events, considered in the aggregate, indicate that it is probable that the entity will be unable to meet its obligations as they become due within one year after the date that the financial statements are issued (or available to be issued). ASU No. 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-15 is effective for the annual period ending after December 15, 2016 and early adoption is permitted. We will continue to evaluate the guidance under ASU No. 2014-15 and present the required disclosures within our financial statements at the time of adoption.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	plan to adopt this new standard in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our annual financial statements for the year ending December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2016 and we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	believe that the adoption of ASU No. 2014-15 will have no material effect on our financial statement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	disclosure
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	54
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In May 2014, the FASB issued ASU No. 2014-09&#x2014;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue from Contracts with Customers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, which supersedes the revenue recognition requirements under ASC Topic 605,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue Recognition
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, and most industry-specific guidance under the ASC. The core principle of ASU No. 2014-09 is that an entity should recognize revenue when it transfers promised goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services. ASU 2014-09 defines a five step process to achieve this core principle and, in doing so, it is possible more judgment and estimates may be required within the revenue recognition process than required under existing U.S. GAAP including identifying performance obligations in the contract, estimating the amount of variable consideration to include in the transaction price and allocating the transaction price to each separate performance obligation. ASU No. 2014-09 also requires additional disclosures to enable users of financial statements to understand the nature, amount, timing and uncertainty of revenue and cash flows arising from customer contracts. ASU No. 2014-09 allows for either full retrospective or modified retrospective adoption, and we have not yet determined which approach we will apply. In July 2015, the FASB deferred by one year the effective date of ASU No. 2014-09 with the new effective date beginning after December 15, 2017, and the interim periods within that year and will allow early adoption for all entities as of the original effective date for public business entities, which was annual reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2016.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We plan to adopt this new standard
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	o
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	n &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	January 1,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are currently evaluating the potential impact of the adoption of ASU No. 2014-09 on our financial statements and cannot estimate the impact of adoption at this time.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2. SPONSORED RESEARCH AND LICENSE AGREEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We conduct research and development programs independently and in connection with our corporate collaborators.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	participant in our collaboration agreement with BMS for the discovery, development and commercialization of cancer immunotherapies based on our small molecule TGF beta receptor kinase inhibitors, as discussed below.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our participation is limited to the Joint Research Committee and the performance of research activities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	based on billable full-time equivalent fees
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	as specified in the agreement.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We do not have ongoing participation obligations under our agreements with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Aclaris
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for the development and commercialization of certain
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	janus kinase (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	JAK
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	inhibitors for the treatment of alopecia areata and other dermatological conditions,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	AstraZeneca (AZ)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for the development and commercialization of R256, an inhaled JAK inhibitor,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	BerGenBio
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for the development and commercialization of an oncology program,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Daiichi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to pursue research related to a specific target from a novel class of drug targets called ligases. Under these agreements, which we entered into in the ordinary course of business, we received or may be entitled to receive upfront cash payments, progress dependent contingent payments on events achieved by such partners and royalties on any net sales of products sold by such partners under the agreements.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Total future contingent payments to us under all of these current agreements could exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	533.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	if all potential product candidates achieved all of the payment triggering events under all of our current agreements (based on a single product candidate under each agreement). Of this amount, up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	150
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million relates to the achievement of development events, up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	345.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million relates to the achievement of regulatory events and up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$37.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million relates to the achievement of certain commercial or launch events.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	This estimated future contingent amount does not include any estimated royalties that could be due to us if the partners successfully commercialize any of the licensed products.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Future events that may trigger payments to us under the agreements are based solely on our partners&#x2019; future efforts and achievements of specified development, regulatory and/or commercial events.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In October 2015, we entered into a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	non-exclusive
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	license agreement with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	a third party, pursuant to which we received a payment in the single-digit millions in exchange for granting a non-exclusive license to certain limited intellectual property rights
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We concluded that the granting of the license, which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	fully delivered to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	such third party
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in the fourth quarter of 2015, represents the sole deliverable under this agreement. Accordingly, we have recognized the payment as revenue during the year ended December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In August 2015, we entered into a license agreement with Aclaris, pursuant to which Aclaris will have exclusive rights and will assume responsibility for the continued development of certain JAK inhibitor compounds for the treatment of alopecia areata and other dermatological conditions. Under the license agreement, we received a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>

	55

	Rigel Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	noncreditable and non-refundable upfront payment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$8.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million in September 2015. We are also entitled to receive development and regulatory contingent fees that could exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$80.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million for a successful compound approved in certain indications. In addition, we are also eligible to receive tiered royalties on the net sales of any products under the agreement. We concluded that the granting of the license, which has been fully delivered to Aclaris in the third quarter of 2015, represents the sole deliverable under this agreement. Accordingly, we have recognized the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$8.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million payment as revenue during the year ended December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In February 2015, we entered into a collaboration agreement with BMS for the discovery, development and commercialization of cancer immunotherapies based on our extensive portfolio of small molecule TGF beta receptor kinase inhibitors. Under the collaboration agreement, BMS will have exclusive rights and will be solely responsible for the clinical development and commercialization of any products. Pursuant to the collaboration agreement with BMS, we received a noncreditable and non-refundable upfront payment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$30.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million in March 2015. We are also entitled to receive development and regulatory contingent fees that could exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$309.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million for a successful compound approved in certain indications. In addition, we are also eligible to receive tiered royalties on the net sales of any products from the collaboration. BMS shall also reimburse us for agreed upon costs based on a contractual cost per full-time equivalent employee in connection with the performance of research activities during the research term. Under the collaboration agreement, we were obligated to provide the following deliverables: (i) granting of license rights to our program, (ii) participation in the Joint Research Committee, and (iii) performance of research activities. We concluded that these deliverables are a single unit of accounting as the license does not have stand-alone value apart from the other deliverables. Accordingly, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$30.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million upfront payment is being recognized ratably as revenue from the effective date of the agreement through September 2016, the end of the estimated research term. We believe that straight-line recognition of this revenue is appropriate as the research is expected to be performed ratably over the research period. During the year ended December 31, 2015, we recognized revenue of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$16.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$82
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	relating to the upfront payment and research activities we performed, respectively. As of December 31, 2015, deferred revenue related to the $30.0 million upfront payment was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$13.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In December 2014, we entered into a severance agreement with our former
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	CEO
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. As part of the severance arrangement we offered, we extended the date to which our former CEO had the right to exercise his vested options
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	within
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	90
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	days from his termination date as was stipulated under his option agreement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to the end of the contractual term
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Rigel Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of the options, of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	remaining contractual term for the most recently granted options is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	nine
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. In addition, we also accelerated the vesting period of certain of his unvested stock options. As a result of these modifications, we recorded
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	incremental
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	based compensation expense of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$1.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million in the fourth quarter of 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(see Note 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;This amount is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	included as part of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201C;General and administrative expense&#x201D; in the accompanying Statement of Operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In September 2013, we announced that we had reduced our workforce by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	18%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	30
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	positions, in connection with efforts to prioritize projects and conserve our working capital. As part of the severance arrangement we offered the terminated employees, we extended the date to which the terminated employees had to exercise their vested options to June&nbsp;30, 2014, rather than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	90
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;days from the termination date as was stipulated under the employee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s option agreements. In addition, we also accelerated the vesting period of certain unvested stock options for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	terminated employee. As a result of these modifications, we recorded non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;cash stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation expense of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$239,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in the third quarter of 2013.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	This expense was classified under &#x201C;Restructuring expense&#x201D; in the accompanying Statements of Operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Employee Stock Option Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have three stock option plans, our 2011 Equity Incentive Plan (2011 Plan), 2000 Equity Incentive Plan (2000 Plan) and 2000 Non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Employee Directors Stock Option Plan (Directors&#x2019; Plan), that provide for granting to our officers, directors and all other employees and consultants options to purc
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	hase shares of our common stock.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Options granted under our 2011 Plan expire no later than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years from the date of grant. Options may be granted with different vesting terms from time to time, ranging from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	zero
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years. As of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	864
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	592
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of common stock were authorized for issuance under the 2011 Plan. There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	214,295
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	options to purchase shares exercised during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	under the 2011 Plan.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Options
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	under the 2000 Plan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	may be granted with different vesting terms from time to time, ranging from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	zero
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years. As of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	12,299,675
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of common stock were authorized for issuance under the 2000 Plan. There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	options to purchase shares exercised during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	under the 2000 Plan.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Options under the Directors&#x2019; Plan may be granted for a maximum term
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The exercise price of options under the Directors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Plan is equal to the fair market value of the common stock on the date of grant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1,188,182
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of common stock were authorized for issuance under the Directors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Plan. There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	options to purchase shares exercised during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	under the Directors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Pursuant to FASB ASC 718, we are required to estimate the amount of expected forfeitures when calculating compensation costs. We estimated the forfeiture rate using our historical experience
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of actual forfeitures
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. We adjust our stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation expense as actual forfeitures occur, review our estimated forfeiture rates each quarter and make changes to our estimate as appropriate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The fair value of each option award is estimated on the date of grant using the Black
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Scholes option pricing model. We have segregated option awards into the following
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	homogenous groups for the purposes of determining fair values of options: officers and directors, all other employees, and consultants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We determined weighted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;average valuation assumptions separately for each of these groups as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 23.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Volatility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#x2014;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We estimated volatility using the historical share price performance over the expected life of the option up to the point where we have historical market data. We also considered other factors, such as implied volatility, our current clinical trials and other company activities that may affect the volatility of our stock in the future. We determined that at this time historical volatility is more indicative of our expected future stock performance than implied volatility.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 23.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Expected term
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#x2014;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	For options granted to consultants, we use the contractual term of the option, which is generally
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	years, for the initial valuation of the option and the remaining contractual term of the option
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	57
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage59"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#RIGL-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Rigel Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	for the succeeding periods. We worked with various historical data to determine the applicable expected term for each of the other option groups. This data included: (1)&nbsp;for exercised options, the term of the options from option grant date to exercise date; (2)&nbsp;for cancelled options, the term of the options from option grant date to cancellation date, excluding nonvested option forfeitures; and (3)&nbsp;for options that remained outstanding at the balance sheet date, the term of the options from option grant date to the end of the reporting period and the estimated remaining term of the options. The consideration and calculation of the above data gave us reasonable estimates of the expected term for each employee group. We also considered the vesting schedules of the options granted and factors surrounding exercise behavior of the option groups, our current market price and company activity that may affect our market price. In addition, we considered the optionee type (i.e.,&nbsp;officers and directors or all other employees) and other factors that may affect the expected term of the option.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">

</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;free interest rate

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">

</FONT>

</FONT>

	as we have not paid and do not expect to pay dividends in the future.

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.74%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">

	72.2

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The exercise price of stock options is determined to be the market price of our common stock on the date
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	immediately preceding the date of grant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. These stock options
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	become exercisable at varying dates and generally expire
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years from the date of grant. At December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, options to purchase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5,245,977
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of common stock were available for grant and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	24,352,449
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	reserved shares of common stock were available for future issuance under our stock option plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

</FONT>
</P>

	related to the

	progress of the Phase 3 clinical program of fostamatinib in ITP

	Of the 3,467,120 common stock options granted during 2014,

	950,000

	700,000

	250,000

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares in the fourth quarter of 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;These remaining shares will vest upon the achievement of certain corporate performance-based milestones related to the progress and success of the Phase 3 clinical program of fostamatinib in ITP.

	&#8209;the
</FONT>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Employee Stock Purchase Plan
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our Employee Stock Purchase Plan (Purchase Plan)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	permits eligible employees to purchase common stock at a discount through payroll deductions during defined offering periods. The price at which the stock is purchased is equal to the lesser of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	85%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of the fair market value of the common stock on the first day of the offering or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	85%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of the fair market value of our common stock on the purchase date. The initial offering period commenced on the effective date of our initial public offering. We issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	76
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	53
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	505,877
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	383,717
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	sh
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ares of common stock during 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectively, pursuant to the Purchase Plan at an average price of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$2.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	03
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2.24
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectively. For 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, the weighted average fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	awards granted under our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Purchase Plan was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	05
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.42
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2.05
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectively. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	001
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	616
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	reserved shares of common stock available for future issuance under the Purchase Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The fair value of awards granted under our Purchase Plan is estimated on the date of grant using the Black
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Scholes option pricing model, which uses weighted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209; average assumptions. Our Purchase Plan provides for a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	twenty
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;four
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	month offering period comprised of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	four
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	six
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;month
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	purchase periods with a look
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;back option. A look
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;back option is a provision in our Purchase Plan under which eligible employees can purchase shares of our common stock at a price per share equal to the lesser of 85% of the fair market value on the first day of the offering period or 85% of the fair market value on the purchase date. Our Purchase Plan also includes a feature that provides for a new offering period to begin when the fair market value of our common stock on any purchase date during an offering period falls below the fair market value of our common stock on the first day of such offering period. This feature is called a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	reset.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Participants are automatically enrolled in the new offering period. We had a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	reset
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on January&nbsp;2, 2014 because the fair market value of our stock on December&nbsp;31, 2013 was lower than the fair market value of our stock on July&nbsp;1, 2013, the first day of the offering period. We applied modification accounting in accordance with ASC Topic No.&nbsp;718,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Stock Compensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, to determine the incremental fair value associated with this Purchase Plan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	reset
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and will recognize the related stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation expense according to FASB ASC Subtopic No.&nbsp;718
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;50,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Employee Share Purchase Plan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. The total incremental fair value for this Purchase Plan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	reset
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	was approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$577,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, that will be recognized from January&nbsp;2, 2014 to December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On January 2, 2015, we had another &#x201C;reset&#x201D; because the fair market value of our stock on December 31, 2014 was lower than the fair market value of our stock on July 1, 2014, the first day of another offering period. We applied modification accounting in accordance with the relevant guidance and determined that the incremental fair value associated with this Purchase Plan &#x201C;reset&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$792,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	that
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	will be recognized from January 2, 2015 to December 31, 2016.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The following table summarizes the weighted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;average assumptions related to our Purchase Plan for t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	he years ended December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Expected volatilities for our Purchase Plan are based on the two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>

	historical volatility of our stock. Expected term represents the weighted

	&#8209; average of the purchase periods within the offering period. The risk

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

</TD>

	4,295
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of December 31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, our cash equivalents and short-term investments had a weighted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;average time to maturity of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	18
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;days. We view our short-term investments portfolio as available for use in current operations.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	Accordingly, we have classified certain securities as short-term investments on our balance sheet even though the stated maturity date of these securities may be more than one year from the current balance sheet date.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have the ability to hold all investments as of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	through their respective maturity dates. At December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	investments that had been in a continuous unrealized loss position for more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	months. As of December 31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	43
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	individual securities had been in an unrealized loss position for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	months or less and the losses were deemed to be temporary.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The gross unrealized losses above were caused by interest rate increases. No significant facts or circumstances have arisen to indicate that there has been any deterioration in the creditworthiness of the issuers of the securities held by us. Based on our review of these securities, including the assessment of the duration and severity of the unrealized losses and our ability and intent to hold the investments until maturity, there were no other-than-temporary impairments for these securities at December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.56%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

	(12)
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.12%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">

	67,386
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	6. FAIR VALUE
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Under FASB ASC 820,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, fair value is defined as the price at which an asset could be exchanged or a liability transferred in a transaction between knowledgeable, willing parties in the principal or most advantageous market for the asset or liability. Where available, fair value is based on observable market prices or parameters or derived from such prices or parameters. Where observable prices or parameters are not available, valuation models are applied.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Assets and liabilities recorded at fair value in our financial statements are categorized based upon the level of judgment associated with the inputs used to measure their fair value. Hierarchical levels directly related to the amount of subjectivity associated with the inputs to fair valuation of these assets and liabilities, are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Level&nbsp;1&#x2014;Inputs are unadjusted, quoted prices in active markets for identical assets at the reporting date. Active markets are those in which transactions for the asset or liability occur in sufficient frequency and volume to provide pricing information on an ongoing basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The fair valued assets we hold that are generally included under this Level&nbsp;1 are money market securities where fair value is based on publicly quoted prices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	62
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage64"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#RIGL-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Rigel Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Level&nbsp;2&#x2014;Are inputs, other than quoted prices included in Level&nbsp;1, that are either directly or indirectly observable for the asset or liability through correlation with market data at the reporting date and for the duration of the instrument&#x2019;s anticipated life.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The fair valued assets we hold that are generally assessed under Level&nbsp;2 included government
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;sponsored enterprise securities, U. S. treasury bills and corporate bonds and commercial paper. We utilize third party pricing services in developing fair value measurements where fair value is based on valuation methodologies such as models using observable market inputs, including benchmark yields, reported trades, broker/dealer quotes, bids, offers and other reference data. We use quotes from external pricing service providers and other on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;line quotation systems to verify the fair value of investments provided by our third party pricing service providers. We review independent auditor&#x2019;s reports from our third party pricing service providers particularly regarding the controls over pricing and valuation of financial instruments and ensure that our internal controls address certain control deficiencies, if any, and complementary user entity controls are in place.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Level&nbsp;3&#x2014;Unobservable inputs that are supported by little or no market activity and that are significant to the fair value of the assets or liabilities and which reflect management&#x2019;s best estimate of what market participants would use in pricing the asset or liability at the reporting date. Consideration is given to the risk inherent in the valuation technique and the risk inherent in the inputs to the model.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We do not have fair valued assets classified under Level 3.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Fair Value on a Recurring Basis
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Financial assets measured at fair value on a recurring basis are categorized in the tables below based upon the lowest level of significant input to the valuations (in thousands):
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	7. PROPERTY AND EQUIPMENT

	$6.5
